Title: "Optimizing Vector Data Indexing in Azure Search: Best Practices"

Single)",            "searchable": true,            "retrievable": true,            "dimensions": 1536,            "vectorSearchProfile": "my-default-vector-profile"        }    ],    "vectorSearch": {        "algorithms": [            {                "name": "my-hnsw-config-1",                "kind": "hnsw",                "hnswParameters": {                    "m": 4,                    "efConstruction":
400,                    "efSearch": 500,                    "metric": "cosine"                }            }        ],        "profiles": [            {                "name": "my-default-vector-profile",                "algorithm": "my-hnsw-config-1"            }        ]Content that you provide for indexing must conform to the index schema and include aunique string value for the document key.
Pre-vectorized data is loaded into one ormore vector fields, which can coexist with other fields containing alphanumeric content.You can use either push or pull methodologies for data ingestion. Use Index Documents (2023-11-01), Index Documents (2023-10-01-Preview), or theAdd, Update, or Delete Documents (2023-07-01-Preview) to push documentscontaining vector data.HTTP    }}Load vector data for indexingPush APIsPOST https://{{search-service-name}}.search.windows.
